page.title: 13RECREATION
page.content: This year Clachnacuddin F.C. will celebrate its centenary."Clach"takes its name from the"Clachnacuddin",the Stone of the Tubs,Inverness's Stone of Destiny.A "Clacher"is a real Invernessian.The club's Grant Street park is the biggest of the three in the town.It can take a crowd of 12 000 with 450 in the stand,but nowadays the Saturday crowd is down to about 300.Local games used to be more popular,1947-1948 was their best cup winning season. Alan Stephenson,their oldest and best player,has played nine seasons.Brian Mackay is the manager and Terry Curtis is the trainer.Some players made first division.Duncan Shearer went to Chelsea for Â£25 000 in 1983.Clach,like Caledonian and Thistle,has its own social club.Caledonian's centenary will be next year.
